intro: Bonnaya pulegiifolia, commonly known as the common bonnaya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
